Since the number of customers is increasing she wants to satisfy her customers. Her goal is to have a larger business so she can offer a variety of food stuff and continue growing.

She is grateful for this new opportunity, which will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

Daniel works hard to provide for his young siblings and extended family. He runs a cosmetic shop in Likoni, Kenya, and requested a 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust to purchase more goods of cosmetics to sell in his shop.

Daniel is applying for his first loan. He has been running the cosmetic shop for two years.

Daniel aspires to save enough money to afford to send his young siblings to college.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Bethleem 2 (#2) Group

texts.en:
Jeannette is a single mother with five children. She also cares for her mother. Jeannette is representing the Bethleem 2 (#2) group. She operates a fish stand in Brazzaville. She has been selling fish in the market for over 20 years! She is a very experienced business owner. She will use the loan to buy fish to replenish her inventory. Jeanette has also begun to sell to other vendors around her. 

Jeannette has received one previous loan from Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. She did very well with her first loan. She hopes to build a house for her family with the profits of her growing business.

loans.use: to pay for fish.

loans.name: Jeimy

texts.es:
Jeimy tiene 28 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 12 años es Christian, de 30 años, con quien tiene dos hijos; el primero de 9 años y el menor de solo un añito. Viven en el terreno de su suegra, ahí construyó su casa a base a mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, es en este lugar donde día a día comparte la alegría de educar a sus hijos y de trabajar con muchas ganas. 

Su actividad es la venta de ropa en diferentes tallas, colores y modelos para damas caballeros y niños. Se encarga personalmente de comprar las prendas, al por mayor, y de seleccionarlas una a una pensando siempre en lo que más le gusta a su público. Lleva en este trabajo 2 años, lo realiza desde su casa o visitando a domicilio. Ha logrado tener una lista de clientes fijos, entre amigos, familiares y conocidos que siempre solicitan la ropa que ofrece, algunas veces a crédito y otras veces al contado. Adicionalmente a esta actividad trabaja también en su casa vendiendo bebidas gaseosas, gelatina, hielo y cerveza, y de manera ocasional, realiza labores domésticas en otras viviendas. Por todas estas actividades recibe ingresos adicionales que le ayudan a mantener su solvencia económica.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace, pues tiene la libertad de manejar su tiempo y organizarse de acuerdo a la disponibilidad de sus clientes. Al principio, como toda persona que recién empieza con un negocio propio, tuvo algunas inseguridades, pero con el tiempo pudo superarlas y ahora es una gran generadora. Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda de ropa.

Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000) comprará gran cantidad de prendas de vestir con los últimos modelos y diseños de verano, que son los más requeridos en la zona calurosa donde vive.
texts.en:
Jeimy is 28 years old and she is a friendly and hardworking woman.  She has been with Christian for 12 years (he is 30 years old) and they have two children together.  The first is 9 years old and the younger child is just one year old.  They live on her mother-in-law's land where they are building a house into which they put all their effort and hard work. It is in this place where they share the good fortune of educating their children and working to get ahead.

Jeimy sells clothing in different styles, colors, and patterns for women, men, and children.  She personally chooses the clothing that she buys wholesale and everything she selects is with her customers in mind.  She had done this work for 2 years and sells the clothing either from her home or she makes house calls.  She has successfully built a list of regular customers that consists of friends, family and acquaintances, and they always ask for the clothes that she sells. She sometimes sells her clothing via credit, and other times for cash.

Additionally, she also works from her home selling soft drinks, ice and beer.  Occasionally she does domestic work in other people's homes.  Because of all of these activities, she earns additional income that helps her to meet all of her financial obligations.

She likes her work because she has the liberty to manage her own time and to organize herself so that she can flexible to her customer's schedules.  At the beginning, like what happens with all entrepreneurs that start a business, she had some concerns.  However, in time, she was able to suppress them and she is now a great businessperson.  In the future she hopes to have a clothing store.

This is her fourth credit with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support and it makes her feel more secure to continue with her business.  She promises to again comply with her payment terms and pay punctually, just like she did with her previous loans.  She is happy to belong to the community bank because all of its members are responsible and caring.

With this loan (2000 soles) she will buy a large quantity of apparel in the latest styles and summer designs, which are the most sought after in the warm region where she lives.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of summer clothing

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 6 to 12 years old. She describes herself to be honest, determined and an ambitious woman. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs three staff members. Her business is located in a conducive business environment. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of ingredients and rent. She will use the 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals. Her business goal is to run two other restaurants in the neighborhood market within five years.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr Jose Luis, tiene 59 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una Colonia al Norte de la ciudad de Olanchito, Yoro. El se dedica a la compra y venta de granos básicos, condimentos y verduras, este negocio lo tiene ubicado en el Mercado Municipal, desde hace 7 años. Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable. Este negocio es rentable y manteniéndolo surtido logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir gastos del hogar. Solicita el préstamo para surtir de verduras, granos básicos y otros para aumentar el volumen de inventarios en su negocio y para aumentar sus ingresos familiares. Siendo su meta personal la de educar a sus hijos, por lo que está decidido a seguir trabajando fuerte.
texts.en:
Jose Luis, age 59, is married and has three children.  He lives in a neighborhood to the north of the city of Olanchito.

He buys and sells basic grains, condiments, and vegetables.  He has had his business at the Municipal Market for seven years.  He is a very hard-working and responsible person.  This business is profitable, and by keeping it stocked he manages to get the income needed to cover the household expenses.

He is requesting the loan to stock up on vegetables, basic grains, and others in order to increase the volume of his inventory and to increase his family’s income.  

As his personal goal is to give his children an education, he is determined to continue working very hard.

loans.use: to stock his business with vegetables, basic grains, and others.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan is married with two children attending a primary school. He is 32 years old and lives with his family in Kompong Cham province. Kan is a farmer and grows rice and potato crops to earn a living. His wife is a good business partner who often assists him in his farming business aside from her duties being a responsible housewife. Kan has been doing this since 2000. 

As of now, Kan has requested his first loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) to till the land and purchase potato plants for growing in this coming season. In the future, he wants to expand his farmland and thereby increase production.

loans.use: to till the land and purchase potato plants for growing in this coming season.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is age 21. She is married with one child of four months. She owns a boutique which has different items. She has requested a loan to buy more sugar, rice, salt and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and salt for sale.

loans.name: Bethleem 2 (#1) Group

texts.en:
Eva, age 39, is a single mother with three kids who are all currently attending school. She also cares for her mother. She is representing the Bethleem 2 (#1) group. Eva sells sandals, large cooking pots, and clothing in a local market in Brazzaville. She has been operating this business for seven years. She will use the loan to buy a large bail of used clothing and to replenish her stock of sandals. Eva’s business strategy is to offer competitive prices and be willing to bargain with customers to find a fair price. 
Eva has received one previous loan from Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. She did well on her first loan. She would like to travel abroad one day to buy merchandise for her business. She hopes to buy a parcel of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for a large bail of used clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Don Roberto tiene 56 años de edad, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Morazan, Yoro, junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos de edades de 3, 6 y 8 años.
Don Roberto tiene más de 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y frijoles. también ha tenido una mini pulpería. La producción de maíz y frijoles la vende en el mercado local. Esta es su fuente de ingresos y la ha mantenido mediante la inversión de préstamos, actualmente solicita el cuarto préstamo a ODEF para seguir dándole mantenimiento a sus cultivos, ya que fertilizando y abonando la tierra va lograr buenas cosechas y sus ventas aumentan más. Su plan es ampliar el área de producción y como meta personal es el compromiso con sus hijos de darle todo lo que necesitan para que tengan calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Roberto is 56 years old. He lives in a neighborhood in the town of Morazan, Yoro, with his wife and three children (ages 3, 6, and 8).

Don Robert has been farming for more than 30 years. He grows primarily corn and beans, but he also operates a mini-grocery store. The corn and beans that he produces are sold at the local market. His crops are his source of income and he is able to maintain this business by investing his loans.

Roberto is currently requesting his fourth loan from ODEF so that he can continue maintaining his crops. He plans to fertilize and compost the land so that he can achieve good harvests and increase his sales. His plan is to expand his production area. On a personal level, he is committed to providing his children with everything they need to have a quality life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Akbarali

texts.en:
Akbarali is a hardworking, unmarried man who works in trading. He's been involved in selling men's clothing for about a year.

His business is located in the central market of Inom. He wants to expand his business in order to be a successful man. Akbarali would like to get a loan to purchase a new assortment of clothing to sell. He hopes to get your support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase new men’s clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tahira Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Tahira bibi is a hardworking and creative woman by nature. She is involved in a carpet-weaving business. Her work requires lots of struggle but she earns well in the end which she utilizes in paying off utilities and the education expenses of her children.
 
Tahira’s husband is also a very hardworking person. He has a vegetable sales business. He sells seasonal vegetables on his donkey cart. He visits different areas and streets to sell the vegetables by announcing their rates. He handles good clients daily and provides them fresh vegetables at reasonable rates. 

Tahira will invest the loan in buying a new donkey cart for her husband because his old cart has become rough and rotten from different areas. The new donkey cart will allow her husband to put vegetables on it and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy a new donkey cart for a vegetable sales business

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: Sophea, age 28, is a mother of two who lives in a rural area of Battambang province and supports the family by growing vegetables for sale. To make additional income for the family, her husband rides a motor taxi during his spare time. Sophea has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles, all of which have been repaid. She is now leading a group of five members to apply for another loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and spend the rest of it on land preparation and labor fees. Sophea hopes that the loan will allow her to increase her crop yields so that she can build a proper house for the family.

loans.use: To spend on land preparation, labor fees and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Bethleem 2 (#3) Group

texts.en:
Roseline, age 32, is married and has two children, ages 2 and 5. She provides and cares for her father as well. Roseline is representing the Bethleem 2 (#3) group. She operates a fish stand in Brazzaville. She has had this business for a little over two years. She will use this loan to buy fish to sell. Her business strategy is to offer a variety of fish at competitive prices. 

Roseline has received one previous loan from Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. She did very well with her first loan. In the future, she would like to start a small bistro serving drinks and food. As her business continues to grow, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to pay for fish.

loans.name: Octavio Federico

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Octavio; Él socio continua con su negocio de elaboracion de artesania ,el socio elabora diversos objetos hechos en arcilla ,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia, el cuenta con un pequeño taller ubicado en su casa, el socio a la vez continua trabajando en una institucion privada,el socio es una persona empeñosa y responsable.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de arcilla.


El socio agradece el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Sr. Octavio is a member of the Communal Bank "Qorichuspa". He lives in the District of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Octavio continues in his business of making handicrafts. He produces various objects made from clay. Octavio enjoys this business and has done very well thanks to the effort he puts forth each day. He has a small workshop located in his home. Octavio also continues to work at a private institution. He is an industrious and responsible individual. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy clay.

Octavio is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promised to complete his payments according to the set terms.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Virgen Purificada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marleny ella es viuda y tiene 44 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de vestidos, ella confecciona diferentes tipos de vestidos para fiesta y también vende accesorios para vestidos, la socia tiene una tienda donde trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar su tienda donde vende los vestidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar telas, botones e hilos para que confeccione los vestidos.
Los socios que estan pegados a al foto grupal se les tomo despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de pizzas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de ropa y negocio de servicio de taxi.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Virgen Purificada” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province and department of Cusco.

The member in question is Marleny, she is a widow, 44 years old, and has two children. She works in her business selling clothes, making different types of clothes for parties and she also selling accessories for items of clothing. She owns a store where she works from 9:00am until 6:00pm; it is through this business that she gets her children ahead. Her dream is to expand and improve her store where she sells the clothes. Marleny seeks this loan to buy fabrics, buttons and threads to make the clothes.

The photographs of the members below the group photo were taken after the meeting because they had to leave for work. The other members work in a pizza business, a grocery store, a clothing business and a taxi service.

Marleny thanks those who have been part of this dream, and she promises to meet the repayments within the set time-frame.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, buttons and threads to make clothes.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with three children, all of whom attend school. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emmanuel has a business making and selling timber at his carpentry shop in Likoni. He has been in this business for five years. 

Emmanuel requested a 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan through Yehu Microfinance to buy new tools and equipment for his workshop business. In the future, Emmanuel would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for his workshop.

loans.name: Phaina

texts.en: Phaina is 46 years old. She has six children between the ages of 6 and 22. She has been selling clothes for two years. With the loan, she will buy more clothes to sell. She plans to use the profits for making savings and paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ana Elisa

texts.es:
Ana, administra un chalet, tiene 22 años, está soltera, vive con sus padres, estudia una carrera universitaria y administra una tienda instalada en un centro escolar, este negocio tiene cinco años de existencia, lo inició junto con su madre y hasta el momento ha logrado ganar una buena experiencia en el manejo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para poderse comprar mercadería como gaseosas, jugos, dulces, boquitas, Pan, chocolates, que son los más demandados por los jóvenes estudiantes, este préstamo le ayudará a fortalecer el negocio y a poder aumentar la variedad de los productos ya que le permitirá tener mejores ventas.
Su objetivo a futuro es tener un negocio más amplio estable y al mismo tiempo poder terminar su carrera y ser una profesional con mejores oportunidades de desarrollo.
texts.en:
Ana manages a food stall. She is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Ana is studying for a university degree and also manages her business that is located on a school campus. This business has been in existence for five years. She started the business with her mother and now she has gained a great deal of experience in managing it.

Ana is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as sodas, juices, candies, snack foods, bread, and chocolates since these items are in high demand among the young students. This loan will help strengthen her business and increase her variety of products, thereby generating more sales. Her goal for the future is to have a larger and more stable business. At the same time, she wants to finish her degree and become a professional with better opportunities for self-development.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, candies, snack foods, bread, and chocolates.

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en:
Savin, aged 41, is a married mother of two children who are still in school. She has been farming rice and planting cassava as the main source of family's income in a village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been in this business for almost 20 years, earning a daily income of around 14,800 KHR from her current business. The main challenge for her is the low crop yields and the decrease in cassava's price. 

Savin's group consists of three members who live in the same village, and she is in her second loan cycle while the other members are first-time loan clients with Kiva's partner VisionFund. Her first loan has helped her better support her family. Savin, who is the group leader, will use her portion of the requested loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir nuevamente en la compra de productos de comida, como las carnes, los vegetales, condimentos, aceite, los granos básicos como el arroz y los frijoles, eso es lo necesario para la producción de los menú en el día a día.
Su resultado con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que su inventario aumentó y la disponibilidad de comida para los clientes también fue mejor, estaría proveído mejores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan to invest it once again in the purchase of food products such as meat, vegetables, dressings, oil and basic grains such as rice and beans, as these are ingredients he needs to prepare his daily menus.
He has obtained good results from his previous loan: he has been able to stock up his inventory thus improving the quality of the food for his customers, and this has granted him a better income to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, dressings, oil, rice and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase welding tools for his work.

loans.name: Andres De Jesus

texts.es:
Andrés, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, solamente él trabaja en la familia, se dedica a la venta de sorbetes y venta de ropa, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, para poder salir con las obligaciones del hogar, lo realiza de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario establecido.
Él solicita un préstamo  para la compra de ropa nueva blusas, camisas, camisetas, ropa interior, para adultos y niños, este préstamo le permitirá realizar una buena compra y crecer en el negocio, teniendo lo necesario para atender a la clientela.
La aspiración de Andrés es tener un negocio más grande, apoyar  a sus hijos y vivir en una mejor condición en la familia.
texts.en:
Andrés lives with his family, his wife and two children. He is the only member of the family who works, and he works selling sorbet and also clothing. This business arose of his own initiative, in order to be able to keep up with his home obligations. He makes his sales as a street vendor and does not have a set schedule.

He is asking for a loan to buy new clothing such as blouses, shirts, T-shirts, and underwear for adults and children. This loan will allow him to make a good purchase and grow his business by having what is necessary to serve his customers. Andrés aspires to have a bigger business, support his children, and live in better conditions with his family.

loans.use: to buy new clothing including blouses, shirts, T-shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Francis

texts.es:
Francis tiene 21 años, es una joven emprendedora, aún soltera y sin hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres junto a su hermano, con quienes trabaja a diario para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de comida rápida (pollo frito). Trabaja a diario, junto a sus padres, desde muy temprano se levanta y se dirige al mercado con la compañía de su madre, en busca de los productos y carnes más frescas para brindar a su clientela siempre lo mejor. En su casa, por las tardes, se encargan de preparar lo que necesitan para tener todo listo a partir de las 6.00 p.m que es el momento en el que comienzan a vender los deliciosos y muy bien servidos platos de pollo broaster. El negocio funciona desde hace 8 años, pero ahora ella se hace cargo desde hace 2 años, ya que antes todo era administrado por sus padres. Con los ingresos que su negocio puede cubrir los gastos que le demandan sus estudios de Medicina Veterinaria. Le está yendo muy bien y es muy optimista en todo lo que hace, tiene como meta poder expandir su negocio, pero por el momento solo espera consolidarse y progresar poco a poco.

Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/.3000) comprará mesas y sillas, así como materiales para realizar una mejora en la condiciones de su local; como arreglo del techo y el piso, además de abastecerse con productos no perecibles y tenerlos en su almacén como reserva y prevención en épocas de precios altos.
texts.en:
Francis, 21, is an enterprising youth who is single and has no children.  She lives in her parent's house with her brother, and they work together each day so that they can have a better quality of life.

She works selling fast food (fried chicken).  She works daily, along with her parents.  She gets up very early and goes to the market along with her mother to look for the freshest products and meat so that they can always provide their customers with the best.  In her house, in the afternoons, they are in charge of preparing the food so that everything is ready by 6pm.  At this time, they start to sell the delicious and well-served plates of roasted chicken.
This business has been running for 8 years, but she has taken charge of it over the last 2 years, because prior to this it was run by her parents.  With the income from this business, she is able to cover the expenses for her Veterinary Medicine studies.  This is going very well, and she is very optimistic in everything that she does.  Her goal is to expand her business, but at this time she just hopes to consolidate the business and gradually make progress with it.

This is her 5th loan with MFP, and she is grateful to them for making it possible for her to continue toward her goals.  Also, she is very committed to making her payments on time as she did with her previous loans.  She is very content with her communal bank, because all of the members are good, friendly and cooperative people.

With the sum of 3,000 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy tables and chairs, and also materials to make some improvements to her business premises, such as repairs to the roof and floor.  In addition, she will stock up on non-perishables to have on reserve in case prices rise.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs, and to make some improvements to her restaurant

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es:
Gaby tiene 22 años, es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Mantiene una relación de convivencia, por 7 años, y fruto de ese amor tiene dos hijos: Daniel de 5 años y Ever de 3 años, ambos pequeños constituyen su principal motor de lucha constante y dedicación en su trabajo. Vive en su casa propia, la que pudo adquirir recientemente con el apoyo de su pareja y están muy felices por ello.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de abarrotes, para ello se encarga de comprar semanalmente, al por mayor, los artículos que pone a la venta en su bodega acondicionada en su casa. Su clientela acude con la seguridad de que en su bodega encontrará todo lo necesario para la preparación de sus alimentos, como pan, leche, huevos, aceite, arroz, frijol, entre otros. Del mismo modo, ha destinado, hace solo unos días, una sección de accesorios y productos de ferretería, ya que ha visto que en el sector donde vive existe mucha demanda de esos artículos. Todos sus clientes son tratados con mucho respeto, cariño y con la alegría que caracteriza su juventud. Gaby se inició vendiendo sólo plátanos y huevos que eran exhibidos en una mesa en la vereda de su casa, poco a poco fue creciendo y ya lleva en este negocio más de 2 años. Atiende las 24 horas del día y desde que se inició en esta actividad ha trabajado sola y se siente muy tranquila y feliz.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la satisfacción de ver a sus clientes que regresan contentos de haber encontrado en su bodega todo lo necesario. Además, este negocio le ha dado independencia y sobre todo solvencia económica para poder manejar los gastos que producen la educación, alimentación y salud de su familia. Espera poder ampliar su tienda, implementarla con mayor diversidad de productos y mantener la clientela que ha logrado conseguir hasta el momento.

Este es su primer crédito MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Y además está satisfecha de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 700) comprará mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites e implementará su sección de ferretería con la compra de clavos, tubos y focos.
texts.en:
Gaby is a 22 year old woman entrepreneur who has a strong desire to get ahead in life.  She has been in a domestic union for 7 years, and has two children with her partner: 5 year old Daniel and 3 year old Ever.  These two little ones constitute her principal motivation for her constant dedication to her work.  She lives in her own home, which she was able to acquire recently with the support of her partner, and they are very happy as a result.  

Her work consists of selling groceries, for which she must purchase the products--that she sells from the store she has set up in her home--at wholesale prices on a weekly basis.  Her clientele comes to her with the surety that in her store they will find every that is necessary for preparing meals, such as bread, milk, eggs, oil, rice, beans, and others.  In the same way, just in the past few days she has set up a section for accessories and hardware products, since she has seen that in the area where she lives there is a lot of demand for such items.  All of her customers are treated with much respect, care and with the joy that characterizes Gaby's youthful exuberance.  

Gaby began by selling just plantains and eggs that she would set up on a table in front of her house, and little by little kept on growing, and now she has been in the business for over 2 years.  She is open 24 hours a day and since she began this business she has worked alone, and she feels very peaceful and happy.  What she likes most in her work is the satisfaction of seeing her customers come back happy to have found in her store everything they need.  This small business has given her independence and general economic solvency to be able to manage the costs coming from feeding her children, watching after their health, and sending them to school.  She hopes to increase the size of her store, stock it with a greater diversity of products and keep the customers that she has been able to attract up until now.  

This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, since as a result she will feel more secure as she moves forward with her work.  She is also committed to following through with her payments in a punctual manner.  She also feels satisfied belonging to her cooperative bank, since all of its members are very responsible and socially conscious.  With the requested loan (700 soles) she will purchase a larger quantity of staple products such as rice, sugar, and oils, and she will stock her hardware section by purchasing nails, piping and light bulbs.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and hardware products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erika Milagritos

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, distrito de Mala con su pareja y sus 2 pequeñas hijas, cuyas edades son de 3 y 10 años, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y servicial, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos, Erika no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder ser profesora de inglés; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus pequeñas hijas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo” el cual es el plato preferido por toda su familia. 
Con el deseo de salir adelante y el apoyo de su pareja, Erika puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de calzado, tanto para hombres, mujeres y niños, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 6 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender un promedio de 6 clientes, Erika cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
Erika se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como zapatos, zapatillas y botines para hombres, mujeres y niños acorde a la temporada de invierno; de esta manera Erika tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, incrementando sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales poco a poco desea ahorrar el dinero suficiente para adquirir su casa propia y así lograr su gran sueño de brindar una mejor educación y calidad de vida para sus hijas.
texts.en:
Erika is a 32 year old woman who lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Mala. She lives with her partner and two young daughters, who are 3 and 10 years old. She is a very hardworking and helpful person, who has directed all of her efforts towards getting her family ahead. Unfortunately, due to the necessity to work and pay bills, Erika was not able to study for a professional career - but she would have liked to be an English teacher. In her free time she likes to play with her little girls, and sometimes she makes "arroz con pollo" [chicken and rice], a delicious dish and her family's favorite. 

With the desire to get ahead and the support of her partner, Erika opened a small business selling shoes for men, women and children. She works approximately six hours a day, during which she can assist an average of six customers. Erika believes that her business is doing well because of her friendly and respectful service that she offers her clients. 

Erika is very appreciative to the Kiva lenders, as it's thanks to their help that she will be able to buy merchandise like shoes, sneakers, and boots for men, women and children for the winter season. In this way Erika will have her business better stocked, increasing her sales and economic income. Little by little she wants to save enough money to get her own home, and reach her big dream of offering a better education and quality of life to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as shoes, sneakers, and boots.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 29 años, es una mujer empeñosa, amable y muy trabajadora. Vive al lado de su pareja, Alexander de 30 años, con quien lleva 11 años de relación y fruto de su amor tienen una hija de 9 años llamada Xiomy, a quien brindan todas las comodidades, tranquilidad y todo lo necesario para que continúe sus estudios. Ellos viven en su casa propia como una familia muy unida y comparten la alegría de buscar juntos el éxito.

Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. A diario realiza esta actividad en su casa, hasta este lugar acuden todos los clientes que requieren de alguna prenda ya elaborada o que solicitan un diseño único y personalizado. Es una mujer muy creativa y desde luego muy detallista, cualidades que se pueden ver reflejadas en el acabado final que da a todas las prendas que elabora. Además de la calidad con que desempeña su trabajo se suma también su gran amabilidad, alegría y el trato servicial que siempre ofrece a sus clientes, es por eso que es muy solicitada.
Adicionalmente, vende bebidas heladas, algunos productos de perfumería y cosméticos.
Lleva trabajando como costurera desde hace mucho tiempo, se inició desde muy joven, eso le ha permitido poder lograr muchas cosas en su vida. Al principio tuvo algunas dificultades, pero con el pasar del tiempo ha ido superando todas las barreras y ahora lo realiza de manera normal y tranquila. Espera seguir progresando y establecer más adelante un taller de diseño, corte y confección, y consolidar su propia marca de ropa.

Este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. También está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/.1500) comprará materiales para continuar con su trabajo de costura, quiere abastecerse con cierres, telas, hilos, elásticos, blondas, botones entre otros accesorios.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29, and is a determined, friendly and very hard-working woman. She lives with her partner Alexander, 30, whom she has been with for 11 years. They have a nine-year-old daughter named Xiomy to whom they provide all the comforts and security of a home, and everything she needs to stay in school. They live in their own house as a very close-knit family, and share the joy of seeking success together.

She makes women's, men's and children's clothing. She carries out this work daily in her home. All the customers who need some ready-made article of clothing, or who request a unique, custom design, come here. She is a very creative woman, and of course very meticulous, qualities that can be seen reflected in the finishing touches she gives all the clothing she makes. In addition to the quality with which she performs her work, there is also her great friendliness, cheerfulness and the helpful service she always offers her customers, That is why she is always very sought after as a seamstress. 

In addition, she sells cold drinks, a few perfume products and cosmetics. 

She has been a seamstress for a long time. She started from a very young age, and that has allowed her to be able to achieve many things in her life. At the beginning she had a few difficulties, but over time she has been overcoming all the obstacles, and now does so in a calm and matter-of-fact way. She hopes to continue progressing and to someday set up a dressmaking shop that also does design, and build up her own clothing brand. 

This is her sixth loan with MFP, so she is greatful to those who make it possible for her to continue toward her goals. Moreover, she is very committed to making her installment payments on time, as she has done with previous loans. She is also very happy to belong to her communal bank, as all its members are good, friendly and supportive people.  

With the amount applied for (1,500 nuevos soles), she will buy materials so that she can continue her sewing work. She wants to stock up on zippers, fabric, thread, lace, buttons and other accessories.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials.

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere invertir en su taller, comprándose una variedad de repuestos nuevos para las motocicletas, ya que no cuenta con la disponibilidad económica para poder realizar la inversión.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue favorable, ya que logro aplicar mas repuestos al negocio, manteniéndolo surtido, para atender las exigencias de los clientes. Considera que su condición familiar está mejorando.
texts.en:
Carlos is requesting a new loan because he wants to invest in his shop; he will buy a variety of new motorcycle parts, as he doesn't have the capital now to make the investment. 

The previous loan had a positive effect, as he was able to bring more parts to the business, maintain a selection of stock, and assist with his customers' requests. He considers his family life to be improving.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 21 años, es un joven optimista, emprendedor, carismático y muy trabajador. Es soltero, pero tiene un hijo a quien protege, cuida y le brinda la atención necesaria. Trabaja mucho para mejorar su nivel de vida, por el bien de su hijo. Actualmente vive con su pequeño en la casa de sus padres, al lado de su madre y su hermana.

Su trabajo consiste en brindar servicio como técnico automotriz y electricista. Se encarga de solucionar los desperfectos que se presentan en las conexiones eléctricas en los vehículos. Trabaja desde las 8.00 am hasta las 7.00 pm, realiza su labor con mucho esmero buscando siempre el mejor resultado para la tranquilidad de sus clientes. Su lugar de atención es en un pequeño local construido en una parte del terreno que un pariente le ha cedido de manera temporal. Trabaja solo y lleva en esta actividad cerca de 6 meses, pero a pesar del corto tiempo se siente satisfecho por la rentabilidad económica que le genera. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que la clientela concurre con mucha frecuencia y todo los días siempre tiene clientes que atender, aunque algunas veces ha encontrado algunas dificultades y ha sentido frustración cuando no ha podido realizar algunos trabajos por falta de las herramientas necesarias. Él espera continuar en este negocio y conseguir un terreno propio para construir su propio taller.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometido, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. También está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) implementará su taller automotriz con algunas herramientas que le faltan como buril, cincel, tenaza, tornillo de banco, calibre, entre otros.
texts.en:
Juan is a 21 year old who is an optimistic, enterprising, charismatic and hard-working young man.  He is single, but has a son who he protects and cares for, giving him the attention he needs.  He works a lot to improve his living conditions, for the well-being of his son.  He is currently living with his little one in his parents' home, along to his mother and his sister.  

His work consists of offering services as an automotive technician and an electrician.  He is responsible for diagnosing and repairing the problems that present themselves in the electrical connections in cars.  He works from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM, carrying out his labor with great care and always looking for the best results for the peace and satisfaction of his customers.  His place of work is located in a small building built on a piece of land that a relative has offered him temporarily.  He works alone and has been doing this for close to 6 months, but in spite of this short time he feels satisfied by the profitability that it generates for him.  What he enjoys in his work is that his customers come very frequently and every day he always has customers to assist, although sometimes he has encountered difficulty and has become frustrated when he can't finish projects due to a lack of the necessary tools.  He hopes to continue in this business and to purchase his own land where he can build his own workshop.  

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and so is thankful to those who make these loans possible so he can continue on with his goals.  He is also very committed, for another time, to follow through with his payments in a punctual manner as he has done with his previous loans.  He is also very content to belong to his cooperative bank, since all of its members are very good, responsible and socially conscious.  With the requested loan (1500 soles) he will set up an auto shop with some tools that he lacks such as an engraver's chisel and other chisels, pliers, vice grips, and a bore among others.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his mechanic shop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisco Edmundo

texts.es:
Francisco está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues inicia la siembra de granos básicos, para esto deberá invertir en abono y herbicidas, que son los necesarios para aplicarlos a la siembra y prevenirla de las plagas.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para invertir en la compra de materiales agrícolas, obteniendo una mejor cosecha libre de plagas, esto le ayudo para el alimento familiar y para poder comercializar una parte.
texts.en:
Francisco is requesting a new loan so that he can begin planting basic grains. He will invest in compost and herbicides since they are needed to apply to his crops in order to prevent pests.

Francisco says that his previous loan was helpful since he was able to invest in the purchase of farming supplies. This enabled him to obtain a better harvest free of pests. He was able to feed his family and sell part of his harvest.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides.

loans.name: Seefa's Group

texts.en:
Seefa has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing center business. She is a very talented businesswoman. She not only teaches the community girls sewing skills but also sews clothes for her customers. Managing her sewing center along with her household works very well. She gives the required time to her work. Seefa’s husband is also a tailor by profession and he sews gents' clothes on order.  

Seefa will invest the loan in buying an electric sewing machine which will help her finish the orders on time and increase her profits. She is very confident about her business success after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for her sewing center business

loans.name: Alexie

texts.en: Alexie is 47 years old. She is married to a farmer. They have three children. She owns a boutique and has spent 25 years in the business. With the loan, she wants to add more items such as cooking oil, sugar and soaps to sell. The profits from the business will be used for saving.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang, age 43, is a resident of Kompong Cham province, where she was born and grew up on the family farm. She has been a rice cultivator for ages with a good farming practice. Besides rice, Lang also grows some types of vegetables for additional income for the family. She is glad because her husband is very helpful and supportive in the maintenance of the rice field. 

Lang wants to achieve financial stability and attain her goals in business, so she is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 riels to add to her savings to purchase a piece of farmland. She hopes to obtain a good harvest in the next season with this expansion. She will use her generated income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 37 years old. She has been selling different items for the past two years in her boutique. With this loan, she wants to add more items such as sugar, soap and lotions to increase the volume of sales. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Dieu Merci 1 Group

texts.en:
Therese, age 50, is married with 3 grown children. She has one child in college. She is representing the Dieu Merci 1 group. 

Therese runs a restaurant in Brazzaville. She will use the loan to buy food and supplies for her restaurant. Her business strategy is to keep a clean and welcoming atmosphere in her restaurant. She understands that customers want to spend time in a place that is pleasing. 

Therese has received 4 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to continue to improve her restaurant and expand to selling fish as well.

loans.use: to pay for food and supplies for the restaurant.

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina is married with four children. She is 55 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Serina has a rice palay buy-and-sell business. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately  5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). 

Serina has been a member of PMPC for six years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to be used to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, Serina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ligia Sofia

texts.es: Con su primer crédito Kiva, Ligia compró ropa en general como jeans, bermudas  en tela de dril y en lycra, blusas y otras prendas femeninas al por mayor que vendió a su clientela dando respuesta a los pedidos que tenía.  Con esto, pudo obtener precios más bajos por pronto pago y volumen que le generaron mayores ganancias.  Con el nuevo crédito quiere seguir comprando con esta modalidad ya que ha visto muy buenos resultados, comprará un mayor surtido de ropa para así conquistar nuevos clientes.  El mensaje para sus financiadores es el siguiente: “Los felicito por apoyar a personas honestas, trabajadoras y humildes en todo el mundo.”
texts.en:
With her first Kiva loan Ligia bought general clothing like jeans, cotton and lycra shorts, shirts, and other women's garments at wholesale, which she sold to her customers in response to their orders. With these purchases she was able to get lower prices by paying promptly and for the volume, which generated greater profits. 

With the new loan she wants to keep buying under this method, as she has already seen very good results. She will buy a good supply of clothing to win over new customers. Her message to her financial backers is the following: "I wish you well for supporting honest, hardworking and humble people all over the world."

loans.use: to buy clothing: jeans, shirts, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 32 years old. She has two children and both go to school. She has been in the boutique business selling different items for the past seven years. 

With the loan she will add more items in the boutique such as rice, sugar and cooking oil. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosta

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 8 filhos dos quais 5 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos alimentares, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material (ferro, cimento, pedra, blocos, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa e mobilar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o alto custo de vida e a saúde da sua família.
texts.en: Rosta is married and is the mother of 8 children, 5 of whom are in school.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports 2 nephews who live with her.  She has her own business selling food products.  With this loan, she will buy iron, cement, stone, bricks, etc., to continue work on her home.  In the future, she hopes to continue work on her home and to furnish it.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the high cost of living and her family's health.

loans.use: to buy materials (iron, cement, stone, bricks, etc.) to continue work on her home.

loans.name: Albino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos ainda menores, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha na Bananalândia como carregador de bananas, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material (areia, cimento, pedra, blocos, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é crescer profissionalmente para melhorar o seu salário.
texts.en: Albino is married and is the father of two young children.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.  He works at Bananalândia loading bananas.  With this loan, he will buy materials (sand, cement, stone, bricks, etc.) to continue work on his home.  In the future, he hopes to finish his home to improve his family's comfort.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is to grow professionally so he can increase his salary.

loans.use: to buy materials (sand, cement, stone, bricks, etc.) to continue work on his home.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 39 years old. She is married with five children, all who go to school. She sells bananas and has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loans from the business, she will buy more bananas to sell. She wants to use the profits from the business for pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She operates a farming business in a village of Kompong Cham province. Every day, she works in the field cultivating rice alongside her husband. She aims to provide a better living to her children. The important thing for her is to create good opportunities for her children’s future education.

As of now, she is asking for a loan amount of KHR 600,000 to pay for the outstanding loan to the food suppliers who cooked for her children’s wedding last time. This loan will help solve a hard situation in the family. She hopes that our lenders won’t reject her loan and she is very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to pay for the outstanding loan to the food suppliers who cooked for her children’s wedding last time.

loans.name: Salomao

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 15 filhos dos quais 1 ainda frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 4 netos que vivem com ele.
Trabalha como agricultor dono de machamba, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar semente de tomate, repolho, pepinos, e adubos para reforçar a sementeira.
No futuro pretende reactivar o seu tractor para dar continuidade a sua actividade e ajudar algumas comunidades nas sachas, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é comprar um novo tractor para auxiliar na sua actividade e aumentar o nível produção.
texts.en: Salamao is the father of 15 children, one of whom is in school.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports 4 grandchildren who live with him.  He works as a farmer on his own land.  With the current loan, he will buy tomato, cabbage, and cucumber seeds and compost to improve his seedbed.  In the future, he hopes to use his tractor to continue working and helping some communities that use hand tools.  To do this, promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is buying a new tractor to help with his work and to increase his level of production.

loans.use: to buy tomato, cabbage, and cucumber seeds and compost to improve his seedbed.

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine, aged 36, is a mother of six children, and all are enrolled in school. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past four years. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mirna Senayda

texts.es:
Mirna tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una colonia de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Mirna hace 7 años estableció su propio negocio de pulpería. Ofrece productos de primera necesidad, como harina, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, lácteos, carnes, pan, productos enlatados, productos de abarrotería, etc.  Ella manifiesta que este negocio es muy rentable ya que son productos que se venden a diario. Mirna es una señora trabajadora se levanta desde muy temprano para atender a sus clientes.
Esta solicitando a ODEF un préstamo de 10,000 para poder invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios  como Frijoles, harina, manteca, carnes, lácteos, embutidos etc. Para seguir ofreciendo a los clientes los productos que demandan.
Su meta es trabajar siempre en su negocio y con el tiempo pueda ser mas grande para tener ingresos con los que pueda darle el estudio a sus hijos y una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Mirna is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a subdivision of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Seven years ago, Mirna established her own grocery business. She offers basic necessity products such as flour, beans, eggs, dairy products, meat, bread, canned goods, and other grocery products. Mirna says that this business is very profitable since her products are sold on a daily basis. She is a hardworking woman who wakes up very early in order to serve her customers.

Mirna is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL from ODEF so that she can invest in the purchase of food products such as beans, flour, lard, meat, dairy products, canned goods, and other items so that she can continue to offer her customers the merchandise they demand. Her goal is to keep working in her business and see it get bigger over time so that she can provide her children an education and a better life.

loans.use: to buy food products to restock her business.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es:
Marjorie es una mujer de 53 años, quien vive en la provincia de Puntarenas, cantón de Golfito, distrito de Guaycara, en el sector de Río Claro.
Ella se dedica a la comercialización de articulos de catálogo tales como cosmeticos, perfumes, ropa interior, los cuales vende en su comunidad Bambel III, mediante el sistema de pagos desde hace ya varios años; este préstamo lo invertira en los mismos articulos que comercializa, lo que hara ahora sera aprovechar los descuentos que ofrecen los proveedores cuando se hacen compras de contado, logrando de esta forma obtener un margen de ganancia mayor.
Marjorie es madre de dos hijas, quienes todavía estan estudiando y su deseo es poder ayudarlas a continuar sus estudios, para que por medio de ello logren mejores oportunidades de las que ella tuvo.
texts.en: Marjorie is a 53 years old woman, who lives in the province of Puntarenas, Golfito canton, Guaycara district, in the Río Claro area. She has been selling catalog products such as, cosmetics, perfumes and underwear, in her community, Bambel III, through a payments system, for several years now. She will invest this loan in the products she sells, what she will do now, is take advantage of the discounts offered by suppliers when cash purchases are made, which will allow her to get a higher profit margin. Marjorie has two daughters who are still studying, and she wishes to be able to help them to continue their studies, and that thanks to that they will get better opportunities than she had.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and underwear

loans.name: Coutinho

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos todos ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É militar do Ministério da Defesa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar um televisor plasma para oferecer melhores condicoes de vida a sua família.
No futuro deseja subir a sua patente profissional, assim como melhorar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e terminar a sua faculdade aumentar a sua renda mensal para melhora a vida familiar.
texts.en: Coutinho is married and the father of 5 children, all of whom go to school.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.  He is in the military and works for the Ministry of Defense.  With this loan, he will buy a plasma television to offer better living conditions to his family.  In the future, he hopes to rise in the ranks professionaly so he can make improvements to his home.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is to work more and to finish college and increase his monthly income to improve his family's life.

loans.use: to buy a plasma television to offer better living conditions to his family.

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.en: Jeanne D’Arc, 46 years old, has five mature children. She has operated a business selling beans and sorghum for 20 years. Jeanne D’Arc has requested this loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. She plans to use the profits for paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Dieu Merci 2 Group

texts.en:
Aubierge, age 32, is married and has 4 children whose ages range from 2 months to 18 years old. She also cares for her elderly father. Aubierge is representing the Dieu Merci 2 group. She has operated a business selling clothing in a local market for 4 years. Aubierge will use the loan to buy bales of clothing from her supplier. In Congo, it is common to buy used clothing in large bales and then the vendor sorts and sells the clothing.

Aubierge has received 4 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to be able to travel to China and buy merchandise for her business one day.

loans.use: to pay for bales of clothes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with seven children. She runs a kerosene selling business. She buys kerosene on a  wholesale basis and resales it to retailers for the local market. She has been operating her business for the last five years.

Fatuma has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance to improve her retail business by buying more kerosene. She is focusing on expanding her kerosene business significantly to be able to earn enough income to meet her growing family’s needs, especially the education of her children.

Fatuma says high competition from kerosene sellers remains her greatest limitation.

loans.use: to purchase kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Burn

texts.en:
Burn, 41 years old, lives in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He has four children who are dependent on him. Burn and his wife earn a living through farming rice and raising pigs. To better support the family and earn more income, his wife sells rice soup and cakes in the market. Burn has been in this business for ten years, earning around 20,000 KHR per day from it. 

This is Burn's second loan with VisionFund. He successfully repaid his first loan which has enabled him to better support his family. Burn is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for his farmland and feed for his pigs. With this loan, he hopes to grow his family's business and earn more income to better feed his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
MADAME COUMBA EST MEMBRE DU BANC VILLAGEOIS DE TAMBACOUMBA CRÉE LE 19 OCTOBRE 2001. ELLE S ACTIVE DANS LA VENTE DE CREVETTE SÉCHÉES.

MADAME COUMBA EST MARIÉE ET MÈRE DE 10 ENFANTS. ELLE EST ÂGÉE DE 44 ANS ELLE PARTICIPE A LA PRISE EN CHARGE DE SA FAMILLE

ELLE COMPTE S APPROVISIONNER DANS LES VILLAGE ENVIRONNANT POUR ALLER REVENDRE DANS LES GRANDES VILLES DE LA RÉGION

ELLE VA ACHETER 375Kg DE CREVETTE A FRAIS ET 800Kg QU ELLE FAIT SÉCHÉ POUR LA REVENTE.

LES PROFIT SERVIRONT A ACHETER DES DENRÉES ALIMENTAIRE POUR SA FAMILLE.
texts.en:
COUMBA is a member of the TAMBACOUMBA Banc Villageois, which was created on October 19, 2001. She is in the business of selling dried shrimp.

COUMBA is marreid and mother of ten children. She is 44 years old, and she participates in caring for her family.

She plans to stock up in the surrounding villages and then sell her goods in the region's larger cities.

She will buy 375 kg of fresh shrimp and 800 kg that she will dry before reselling.

The profits will allow her to buy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy dried shrimp

loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es:
Lucia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que desea continuar trabajando en su negocio, manteniendo un negocio surtido de verduras frescas como zanahorias, güisquiles, papas, repollo, tomates, y otras en general que son necesarias para poder ofrecer a la clientela.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior fue un gran aporte para ella, pues hasta el momento se ha mantenido con sus ventas en el mercado, pues le facilito los recursos económicos para crecer en el inventario, con la nueva deuda espera tener tambien una buena experiencia.
texts.en: Lucia, is asking for a new loan, since she wants to continue working in her business, keeping it well-stocked with fresh vegetables such as carrots, chayote, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes and others, which she needs to have available to offer to her customers. She considers the previous loan has been a big contribution for her, since it has allowed her to continue selling in the market up to now, by providing the financial resources needed to increase the inventory. She expects to have a good experience with the new loan as well.

loans.use: to buy carrots, chayote, potatoes, cabbage and tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more meat to expand his meat roasting business

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 30 years old, is an industrious father of a lovely young child. He lives with his wife and child in Ang Snoul district, Kandal province. Lim and his wife met each other in a garment factory, where they work to earn their livelihoods. Together, they are able to earn approximately US $10 per day to cover their daily expenses.

Due to lack of capital to get the construction of his house finished, Lim would like to borrow a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy construction materials and to pay for labor costs. In the future, Lim anticipates having a clothes shop in his commune where he can provide tailoring services to local people.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Amour Du Prochain 1 Group

texts.en: Jean Pierre is married with two children. He also cares and provides for his elderly father. Jean Pierre is representing the Amour du Prochain 1 group. He sells sandals in a local market. He has been operating this business for over five years. He will use this loan to buy sandals to reinforce his merchandise. His business strategy is to open his business early and on a consistent basis at a consistent time. He also feels it is important to keep his area clean and organized for the customers. Jean Pierre has received four previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He wants to grow his business into a large shoe store.

loans.use: to pay for sandals.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Age 53, Mary is a widow living with her six children in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She still has three children dependent on her; one of them is still in school, while the others work in a garment factory. Cassava and cashew planting is the primary source of her family's income to support their daily living. She has been in this business for six years. She is challenged to feed her children nutritious food with the income earned from the business. 

Mary has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and successfully paid back the loans. She used the loans to better support her children with nutritious food. With a need to support her business, she is requesting a loan from VisionFund of 2,000,000 riels. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of it for labor and to plow the land. She hopes to make more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for labor and plowing the land.

loans.name: Saina

texts.ru:
Сыйне 59 лет, вдова, воспитала 8 детей. Будучи активным человеком, Сыйна смогла дать образование своим детям - 2 дочери стали учителями, сын – строитель. В качестве источника финансирования для ее семьи, Сыйна с 1982 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Сыйны имеется 10 овец  с приплодом, выручка в продажи мясных продуктов составляет около 8,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сыйна обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Сыйна планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Siyne is 59 years old, widowed, and has raised eight children. An active person, Siyne was able to provide an education for her children; two daughters are teachers, and one of her sons is a builder. To provide for her family, Siyne has been raising livestock since 1982. She started her business with 10,000 somi (KGS); today her business includes 10 sheep with offspring, and the monthly earnings fron selling meat products comes to about 8,000 somi.

To develop her business further. Siyna has turned to Bai-Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 somi (KGS) to buy more livestock. Siyna plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Balbino De Jesus

texts.es:
Balbino, administra una tienda, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, el negocio surgió por el apoyo de su familia, junto a su esposa realizaron la inversión, no tienen un horario establecido para atenderlo.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, ya que surtirá el negocio de productos como arroz, frijol, aceite, queso, entre otros que son necesarios para poder mejorar la disponibilidad de mercadería, esta compra le permitirá crecer y mejorar la atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de Balbino, es a través del préstamo, lograr el mejoramiento del negocio, una buena inversión, que le ayude a mantenerse en las ventas, proveyendo siempre para su familia lo necesario.
texts.en: Balbino manages a store; he lives with his wife and his children. The business started thanks to the support of his family. Together with his wife, they made the initial investment. They don't have a fixed schedule for opening hours. He requests a loan to buy convenience store items, to stock the business with products, such as rice, beans, oil, and cheese among others, that are needed to improve the availability of merchandise. This purchase will allow him to grow and to better satisfy his customers. Balbino's aspiration is to use the loan, to improve the business and make a good investment that will allow him to keep up the sales, and support his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil and cheese

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Ruth” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders seeking a loan of 1,200,000 Sierra Leonean leones each in order to invest in their businesses.

Halima is the leader of this group. Halima is 45 years old. She is married with six children attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Halima sells market food – Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), dried fish, pepper, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. With the help of this loan, Halima will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy Maggi, dried fish, pepper, etc., in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Daysi Marina

texts.es:
Daysi, es una persona de hogar, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella junto a su esposo realizan las labores agrícolas, sembrando maíz y frijol para el sostenimiento del hogar.
Actualmente iniciará la siembra de invierno para esto solicita la compra de abono, semillas, herbicidas, y la preparación del terreno, ya que junto a su pareja desean iniciarlo, este préstamo les ayudará para tener lo necesario y poder fortalecer y prevenir el cultivo de las plagas.
El objetivo de ella es apoyar a su esposo y a su hijo a través de su trabajo, de este cultivo espera tener una abundante producción que le pueda generar ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Daysi is a homemaker who lives with her husband and son. She and her husband handle the farm work, growing corn and beans in order to sustain their household. Daysi is about to start the winter planting, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, seeds, herbicides and to pay for the preparation of her land. She and her partner would like to get started so this loan will help them acquire what is needed to strengthen their crops and prevent pests.

Daysi's goal is to support her husband and her son through her work with these crops. She hopes to have an abundant production so that she can generate income for her family.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, herbicides and to pay for the preparation of her land.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назире 32 года, замужем и имеет 3 детей – школьников. В качестве основного источника финансирования своей семьи, Назира занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес после замужества с покупки 3 бычков. Благодаря упорному труду, Назира с мужем смогли купить дом в селе Каинды, где и живут по сей день. На сегодня в хозяйстве Назиры имеется одна дойная корова с приплодом, что приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS).  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, чтобы сделать накопления на будущее образование для своих детей.
texts.en: Nazire is 32 years old, married, and has three young children. As the chief source of support for her family, Nazira has a livestock business which she started with three bulls after she got married. Thanks to her hard work, Nazira and her husband were able to buy a house in the village of Kaindy, and where they still live. Today Nazira's business currently consists of  one dairy cow and a calf, which earns her a monthly income of 15,000 somi (KGS). To develop her business further, Nazira has turned to Bai-Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount fo 60,000 somi (KGS) to purchase more livestock. Nazira plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into further expanding her business so they can save enough for her children's future eduction.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for his corn and bean crops

loans.name: Gaybullo

texts.ru: Гайбулло кредитуется с нашей организацией уже несколько лет, но в течении 2 лет он не получал у нас кредит. Теперь когда дети выросли и потребностей  стало больше, он вынужден продолжить развивать свой бизнес.Гайбулло занимается выращиванием скота.Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 25 лет.Этому бизнесу его научил его отец.Он покупает скот с рынка скотов и откормив, продает на том же рынке уже по дороже. В настоящий момент он получает кредит для увеличение поголовья скота.Он планирует купить коров чтобы одновременно продавать молоко. В конце осени он продаст корову и купит мелко рогатый скот,  который легче держать и ухаживать зимой.
texts.en: Gaybullo has received loans from MDO Arvand, LLC, for several years, but has not received any loans for the last two years. Now that his children have grown up and their needs have increased, he has had to keep develop his business further.  Gaynullo has a livestock business, and has been doing this type of work for 25 years. His father taught him the business: he buys animals at the livestock market, fattens them, and then sells them at the same market for a profit. He has asked for a loan to increase his number of livestock. He plans on buying a cow so he can sell the milk. At the end of autumn, he will sell the cow and buy a goat or sheep, which will be easier to keep and take care of during the winter.

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Nonvignon 2 Group

texts.fr: «NONVIGNON 2» est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo) est nommée Sylvie Marie-Rose. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Âgée de 42 ans, Sylvie Marie-Rose est mariée à un certain Karim. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sylvie Marie-Rose assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Sylvie Marie-Rose vend depuis une douzaine d’année, des ustensiles de cuisine et de l’huile végétale dans un quartier du Bénin, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les besoins de sa famille. Sylvie Marie-Rose achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Sylvie Marie-Rose et aux autres membres du groupe «NONVIGNON 2», de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The «NONVIGNON 2» group has three members.  The group's representative (who is raising her finger in the photo) is called Sylvie Marie-Rose.  The members of this group all live in the same neighborhood.  With the aim of increasing their working capital, they are requesting their first loan from ALIDé.  

Sylvie Marie-Rose is 42 years old and married to Karim.  The couple have four children who all attend school and are still in their care.
